Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Circle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WaterWave

    public class Circle
extends java.lang.Object
    The Circle class represents a double precision Circle. It can perform common calculations as well as drawing a representation of the circle to a Processing PApplet.
    Version:
    5.23.21
    Author:
    vicram_vijayakumar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Creates a default instance of a Circle object with all dimensions set to zero.
      Circle(double x, double y, double extent)
      Creates a new instance of a Circle object having a diameter equal to the inputed extent with the center of the Circle at (x, y).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToDiameter(int value)
      Sets the diameter of the Circle to it's current diameter combined with the inputed value.
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker)
      Draws a new instance of a Circle object with the center at getX() and getY().
      double getArea()
      Calculates and returns the area of the Circle.
      double getCenterX()
      Gets the x-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.
      double getCenterY()
      Gets the y-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.
      double getDiameter()
      Gets the diameter of the Circle.
      double getLeftPointX()
      Gets the X coordinate of the left most point of the Circle.
      double getPerimeter()
      Calculates and returns the perimeter of the Circle.
      double getRightPointX()
      Gets the X coordinate of the right most point of the Circle.
      boolean isPointInside(double x, double y)
      Determines whether the point (x, y) is contained inside the Circle.
      void setDiameter(double extent)
      Sets the diameter of the Circle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle()
        Creates a default instance of a Circle object with all dimensions set to zero.

      • Circle

        public Circle(double x,
              double y,
              double extent)
        Creates a new instance of a Circle object having a diameter equal to the inputed extent with the center of the Circle at (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - X value of the Circle's center point.
        y - Y value of the Circle's center point.
        extent - The diameter of the Circle.

    • Method Detail

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()
        Calculates and returns the perimeter of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The perimeter of the Circle.

      • getArea

        public double getArea()
        Calculates and returns the area of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The area of the Circle.

      • isPointInside

        public boolean isPointInside(double x,
                             double y)
        Determines whether the point (x, y) is contained inside the Circle.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the point which is being checked if it is inside the Circle.
        y - The Y coordinate of the point which is being checked if it is inside the Circle.
        Returns:
        true if the point (x, y) is contained inside the Circle.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker)
        Draws a new instance of a Circle object with the center at getX() and getY().
        Parameters:
        marker - The Processing PApplet on which to draw the Circle.
        Precondition:
        The Circle will be drawn with attributes previously set on the given PApplet.
        Postcondition:
        The Processing PApplet on which the Circle is drawn is changed.

      • getLeftPointX

        public double getLeftPointX()
        Gets the X coordinate of the left most point of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The X coordinate of the left most point of the Circle is the point is not null.

      • getRightPointX

        public double getRightPointX()
        Gets the X coordinate of the right most point of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The right most point of the Circle is the point is not null.

      • addToDiameter

        public void addToDiameter(int value)
        Sets the diameter of the Circle to it's current diameter combined with the inputed value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be added to the diameter of the Circle.

      • getDiameter

        public double getDiameter()
        Gets the diameter of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The diameter of the Circle.

      • setDiameter

        public void setDiameter(double extent)
        Sets the diameter of the Circle.
        Parameters:
        extent - The new value for the diameter of the Circle.

      • getCenterX

        public double getCenterX()
        Gets the x-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The x-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.

      • getCenterY

        public double getCenterY()
        Gets the y-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.
        Returns:
        The y-Coordinate of the center of the Circle.
